description_txt: stated on August 23, 2012 in a political action committee report:
quote_txt: Says that like Todd Akin, all Texas Republicans in U.S. House cosponsored a bill "that attempts to distinguish between ‘forcible rape’ and other sexual assaults."

description_txt: stated on July 30, 2012 in an advertisement in the Wall Street Journal:
quote_txt: "We have more scientists and engineers per square mile than anywhere in the world."

description_txt: stated on September 5, 2012 in his Democratic National Convention speech:
quote_txt: The stimulus program "cut taxes for 95 percent of the American people."

description_txt: stated on September 5, 2012 in a speech to the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C.:
quote_txt: "Since 1961 … our private economy has produced 66 million private-sector jobs. So what's the jobs score? Republicans 24 million, Democrats 42 (million)."

description_txt: stated on September 5, 2012 in a convention speech:
quote_txt: Mitt Romney said we should let foreclosures "hit the bottom."

description_txt: stated on September 5, 2012 in a Democratic National Convention speech:
quote_txt: Women "receive only 77 cents for every dollar a man earns."

description_txt: stated on September 5, 2012 in a speech at the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C. :
quote_txt: When it comes to jobless workers, "Mitt Romney says he likes to fire people."

description_txt: stated on September 4, 2012 in a speech at the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C.:
quote_txt: "Republicans would give seniors a (Medicare) voucher that limits what's covered, costing seniors as much as $6,400 more a year."

description_txt: stated on September 2, 2012 in a speech:
quote_txt: Says Republicans Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan support "massive cuts in Social Security for future generations."

description_txt: stated on September 4, 2012 in comments to Fox News:
quote_txt: Says she was misquoted and "didn’t say" that the Israeli ambassador said "what the Republicans are doing is dangerous for Israel."

description_txt: stated on September 5, 2012 in an appearance on Late Night with Jimmy Fallon:
quote_txt: Says Bruce Springsteen played in 1975 at Seton Hall University in South Orange at Walsh gym.

description_txt: stated on September 4, 2012 in a keynote speech to the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C.:
quote_txt: "Seven presidents before (Barack Obama) -- Republicans and Democrats -- tried to expand health care to all Americans."

description_txt: stated on August 23, 2012 in a town hall meeting in Merrimack, N.H.:
quote_txt: "Under President Bush in eight years, we added $4.9 trillion to the debt. Under President Obama, we've added $5.3 trillion to the debt in the 3.5 years he's been in office."

description_txt: stated on September 4, 2012 in keynote address to the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C.:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney told university students in Ohio that to start a business, they should "borrow money if you have to from your parents."

description_txt: stated on September 4, 2012 in remarks at the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C.:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney has put forward a plan "that would cut taxes for millionaires while raising them for the middle class."

description_txt: stated on August 27, 2012 in a campaign speech:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney’s tax plans would "give an additional $250,000 tax cut to millionaires and billionaires" while raising taxes on the middle class.

description_txt: stated on August 28, 2012 in a TV debate:
quote_txt: "We will spend $100 billion in Afghanistan this year, fixing roads, building bridges, training police officers, and more, [and] cutting the same things in our own country."

description_txt: stated on September 4, 2012 in a speech at the Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C.:
quote_txt: "By the time (Mitt Romney) left office, Massachusetts was 47th in the nation in job creation."

description_txt: stated on September 4, 2012 in keynote address at Democratic National Convention.:
quote_txt: Says Milken Institute rated San Antonio as nation’s top-performing local economy.

description_txt: stated on September 4, 2012 in a rally at the Democratic National Convention:
quote_txt: "The first (state) budget that came out of our Republican leadership slashed funding to Planned Parenthood...It resulted in the reduction of hours, the elimination of days, elimination of access to women in my city and all over my state."

description_txt: stated on September 2, 2012 in a concert in Fort Worth.:
quote_txt: Says Barack Obama is a Muslim.

description_txt: stated on August 28, 2012 in a Tampa Bay Times guest column:
quote_txt: In 2008, Charlie Crist ‘"applauded the pick of Sarah Palin and said she would do ‘a great job.’"

description_txt: stated on August 26, 2012 in a TV interview.:
quote_txt: The GOP platform that seeks further limits on abortion and is silent on an exception for rape "has been there for more than 30 years."

description_txt: stated on August 15, 2012 in an interview:
quote_txt: Federal law adopted "under Tommy Thompson's watch" prohibits the government from negotiating for "better prices" on prescription drugs for senior citizens

description_txt: stated on August 28, 2012 in an interview on "CBS This Morning":
quote_txt: Says Chris Christie was the "first governor in America to endorse" Mitt Romney.

description_txt: stated on August 27, 2012 in an op-ed in Politico:
quote_txt: Says Gov. Chris Christie has embarked on a tour to "demand that New Jersey’s Democratic legislature approve an immediate tax cut that would disproportionately benefit the wealthiest."

description_txt: stated on August 28, 2012 in in a press release.:
quote_txt: Says a federal judge "sanctions Tennessee ‘birther’ lawyer … for bringing a frivolous lawsuit."

description_txt: stated on August 28, 2012 in an online debate:
quote_txt: U.S. military uniforms are manufactured in China.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • September 2, 2012

description_txt: stated on August 29, 2012 in a speech:
quote_txt: Says opponents of the health care law  "prevailed on our two main arguments" to the U.S. Supreme Court.

description_txt: stated on August 30, 2012 in remarks at the Republican National Convention in Tampa:
quote_txt: At Bain Capital, "we helped start an early childhood learning company called Bright Horizons that First Lady Michelle Obama rightly praised."
